page.title: 19Village soccer,Llanddulas
page.content: According to older villagers,the club formed in 1921-1922, so that first world war servicemen could play competitive football.They played in various fields in the village,Clip Terfyn field behind the Fair View, the field where Bron Wern is now, and later on, the school pitch on Minffordd Rd. There have been a number of internationals,Mr Willie Morris, Mr Iori Hughes, Rev. Hywel Davies. These all played for Llanddulas,or the Quarry men as they were called. The team continued to function during the second world war,as the locals went in to the services.Civil servants filled the empty spaces, and when the war ended local lads took their place.The village had a strong team in the Clwyd League until 1982. The pitch is used by our school team.
